Description:
At the side of the chamber, you find a beggar who is telling everyone who passes by that he knows the secret entrance the guards use to kidnap people without anyone noticing.

The people who pass near him try to avoid eye contact, and the guards seem to ignore him.

It is a dangerous topic, and the only reason he may still be alive is because he’s either crazy or just a liar, but it might be interesting to hear what he has to say.
DescriptionAction: Will you listen to the beggar?

    "SSRewardText": "(Tulah): \"The guards let him talk because they know that if they arrest him, someone else will come along saying the same things. They prefer to leave him alone and ignore him, even though what he's saying is true.\r\n\nIt also serves as a reminder to the people that the guards commit those despicable acts to appease the Great Bird's bloodlust. We should continue our journey and not worry about him; that man has found safety in his feigned madness.\"\r\n\r\nYou follow Tulah’s advice and continue exploring the temple. It seems Tulah knows what she's doing.",

    "SSRewardText": "You do as Nezglek advises and get close to the beggar, telling him that you believe what he is saying.\n\nThe beggar is both surprised and pleased that there are still some sensible people around the temple. He tells you that the side ladder giving access to the temple is precarious on purpose, but when the guards want to kidnap someone into the temple, they use an additional, magically hidden ladder that they uncover with an enchanted feather.\n\nThe beggar says he enjoyed your company very much and gives you one of the enchanted feathers, telling you to check the ladder for yourselves!",

    "SSRewardHealthPercent": 0.0,
    "SSRewardText": "(Yogger): “You’d better tell me what you know, and it had better be true, or I might get angry, buddy. And you don’t want to see me angry.”\r\n\nThe beggar is intimidated by Yogger and tells you, in a trembling voice, that the guards use an enchanted feather to reveal a hidden rope ladder near the auxiliary entrance. They use it to avoid activating the great elevator at night. He offers to give you one of those feathers so you can try it for yourselves if Yogger lets him go.\r\n\n(Yogger): “I accept. Now give me the feather, and all the gold you gathered today, too. See? I’m a reasonable werewolf. Now get out of my sight.”",

    "SSRewardText": "(Thuls): \"Sss... I won’t hesitate to kill you if you lie to me. Choose your words carefully.\"\r\n\nThe beggar smiles kindly at Thuls and tells him he understands how the lizardman feels, as most of the people the guards kidnap this way are lizardmen. He explains that the guards use an enchanted feather to reveal a hidden rope ladder near the auxiliary entrance, which they use to avoid activating the great elevator at night.\r\n\nThe man hands Thuls one of these feathers and warns him that what he will discover there will not please him. Thuls nods slowly, with a determination never seen before in the lizardman’s eyes.",
